meanings.definition: A person or thing that bursts.
meanings.sent1: The balloon burster popped all the balloons at the party.
meanings.sent2: The water burster burst open when it was filled beyond its capacity.
meanings.sent3: The bubble wrap burster had a habit of popping bubble wrap whenever they were nervous.
meanings.sent4: The stress burster exploded with frustration after a long day at work.
meanings.sent5: The volcano burster erupted with a loud boom, spewing lava and ash into the sky.

meanings.definition: A sudden, violent outburst or explosion.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm burster startled everyone with its sudden lightning and thunder.
meanings.sent2: The temper burster exploded when he couldn't find his keys.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn burster in the microwave made a mess when it burst all over the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The anger burster inside him finally erupted, causing a scene at the party.
meanings.sent5: The balloon burster burst with a loud bang, surprising the children at the birthday party.

meanings.definition: A type of firework that explodes with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The firework burster lit up the night sky with its colorful display.
meanings.sent2: The celebration burster added excitement to the event with its bright bursts.
meanings.sent3: The holiday burster was a hit at the New Year's Eve party, dazzling everyone with its explosions.
meanings.sent4: The sky burster burst into a shower of sparks, mesmerizing the crowd below.
meanings.sent5: The firecracker burster crackled and popped, filling the air with festive sounds.
